Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: black with lotus buds in added white outline and added red centres; to centre, white band; exterior: wide brown-fired band and three narrow bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2221) (phase 3)
Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 33, no. A 1e)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: I.A 1e (cat. no. in Prins de Jong 1925)
